pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:5.1: 15. The training rule on swaying the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their bodies and leaning them on supports while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:7.2: “‘I will not sway my body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not sway one’s body;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:8.2: one should walk keeping the body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:8.3: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his body and leans it on a support while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:10.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
